Manager, I want to see my sites Forecasted External Revenue in the P&L View based on Forecasted Statistics, so that I can see accurate Trend information (Actual + Forecast) for my site(s)<br>User Flow<br>Account Manager navigates to the Forecasting module in the system<br>Account Manager selects a site from their assigned locations<br>Account Manager selects the ""P&L View"" from the navigation menu<br>System retrieves Forecasted Statistics & information from Dataverse<br>System calculates Forecasted External Revenue using appropriate formula<br>System combines all available External Revenue calculation outputs (based on Statistics) <br>System displays the initialized P&L View with calculated External Revenue Forecast values<br>Data Element<br>Data Use Category<br>Example Formula<br>Example Queries / Notes<br>EXTERNAL REVENUE<br>Forecast<br>[External Revenue] = [Valet Daily External Revenue] + [Valet Monthly External Revenue] + <br>[Self Daily External Revenue] + [Self Monthly External Revenue] + <br>[Self Aggregator External Revenue] + [Valet Aggregator External Revenue] + <br>[Self Overnight External Revenue] + [Valet Overnight External Revenue]<br>Where:<br>[Valet Daily External Revenue] = [Valet Daily Forecasted Statistic] × [Valet Daily Forecasted Rate]<br>[Valet Monthly External Revenue] = [Valet Monthly Forecasted Statistic] × [Valet Monthly Forecasted Rate]<br>[Valet Overnight External Revenue] = [Valet Overnight Forecasted Statistic] × [Valet Overnight Forecasted Rate]<br>[Self Daily External Revenue = [Self Daily Forecasted Statistic] × [Self Daily Forecasted Rate]<br>[Self Monthly External Revenue = [Self Monthly Forecasted Statistic] × [Self Monthly Forecasted Rate]<br>[Self Aggregator External Revenue = [Self Aggregator Forecasted Statistic] × [Self Aggregator Forecasted Rate]<br>[Valet Aggregator External Revenue = [Valet Aggregator Forecasted Statistic] × [Valet Aggregator Forecasted Rate]<br>[Self Overnight External Revenue = [Self Overnight Forecasted Statistic] × [Self Overnight Forecasted Rate]<br>From Forecast Site Statistics tab<br>For partially actualized months, the PL view needs to calculate based on combo of actual + forecast<br> | 1982                                                                                                                                                                     | Forecasting | As an Account Manager, I want to see P&L View's Forecasted [Per Occupied Room] Internal Revenue using Powerbill data combined with Forecast data, so that I can observe accurate financial trends of the sites for which I'm responsible.<br>User Flow<br>Account Manager navigates to the Forecasting module in the system<br>Account Manager selects a [Per Occupied Room] site from their assigned locations<br>Account Manager selects the ""P&L View"" from the navigation menu<br>System retrieves deal structure information from Powerbill<br>System calculates [Per Occupied Room] Internal Revenue component using appropriate formula with escalators<br>System combines all Internal Revenue components and adds Other Revenue from Forecast<br>System displays the P&L View with calculated [Per Occupied Room] Forecasted Internal Revenue values<br>Data Element<br>Data Use Category<br>Example Formula<br>Example Queries / Notes<br>INTERNAL REVENUE<br>Budget<br>[INTERNAL REVENUE] = [BUDGET_CATEGORY_MONTHLY_TOTAL]*(-1)<br>SELECT SUM([BALANCE]) AS BUDGETED_CATEGORY_MONTHLY_TOTAL<br>FROM [TP_EDW].[dbo].[BUDGET_FINAL] AS budget<br>JOIN [TP_EDW].[dbo].[CHART_OF_ACCOUNT] AS coa ON budget.MAIN_ACCOUNT = coa.MAIN_ACCOUNT<br>WHERE [COST_CENTER] = '0170'<br>AND [PERIOD] = '202503'<br>AND [IS_SUMMARY_CATEGORY] = 'INTERNAL REVENUE'<br>------------------<br>BUDGETED_CATEGORY_MONTHLY_TOTAL<br>-279663.89000<br>INTERNAL REVENUE<br>Forecast<br><br>                [PER OCCUPIED ROOM IR] = [PER OCCUPIED ROOM FEE] * [FORECASTED OCCUPIED ROOMS] + [ESCALATORS]<br>First we calculate the Internal Revenue per deal type in order to consider escalators and other deal-specific nuance, then we add all elements together along with anything entered in the 'Other Revenue' tab from the Forecast in order to find the final INTERNAL REVENUE per month (Forecast).<br>NOTE: Where escalators are involved, they only apply to the months following their trigger date.<br>NOTE: BILLABLE ACCOUNTS should only be considered a 'deal type' in cases WHERE [BILLABLE ACCOUNTS] = ENABLED AND [MANAGEMENT AGREEMENTS] = DISABLED<br> | 2107                                                                                                                                                                     | Forecasting | As an Account Manager, I want to calculate my P&L View's Forecasted [REVENUE SHARE] Internal Revenue using Powerbill data combined with EDW data, so that I can observe accurate financial trends of the sites for which I'm responsible<br>User Flow<br>Account Manager navigates to the Forecasting module in the system<br>Account Manager selects a site from their assigned locations<br>Account Manager selects the ""P&L View"" from the navigation menu<br>System automatically identifies applicable deal types for the selected site<br>System retrieves deal structure information from Powerbill<br>System pulls relevant budget data from EDW based on deal types<br>System calculates each Internal Revenue component using appropriate formulas with escalators<br>System combines all Internal Revenue components and adds Other Revenue from Forecast<br>System displays the initialized P&L View with calculated Internal Revenue values<br>Admin user can review the Internal Revenue data broken down by deal type<br>Data Element<br>Data Use Category<br>Example Formula<br>Example Queries / Notes<br>INTERNAL REVENUE<br>Budget<br>[INTERNAL REVENUE] = [BUDGET_CATEGORY_MONTHLY_TOTAL]*(-1)<br>SELECT SUM([BALANCE]) AS BUDGETED_CATEGORY_MONTHLY_TOTAL<br>FROM [TP_EDW].[dbo].[BUDGET_FINAL] AS budget<br>JOIN [TP_EDW].[dbo].[CHART_OF_ACCOUNT] AS coa ON budget.MAIN_ACCOUNT = coa.MAIN_ACCOUNT<br>WHERE [COST_CENTER] = '0170'<br>AND [PERIOD] = '202503'<br>AND [IS_SUMMARY_CATEGORY] = 'INTERNAL REVENUE'<br>------------------<br>BUDGETED_CATEGORY_MONTHLY_TOTAL<br>-279663.89000<br>INTERNAL REVENUE<br>Forecast<br><br>                [REVENUE SHARE IR] = [FORECASTED EXTERNAL REVENUE] * [POWERBILL REVENUE SHARE PERCENTAGE PER TIER] + [ESCALATORS (Including Threshold Escalators)]<br>First we calculate the Internal Revenue per deal type in order to consider escalators and other deal-specific nuance, then we add all elements together along with anything entered in the 'Other Revenue' tab from the Forecast in order to find the final INTERNAL REVENUE per month (Forecast).<br>NOTE: Where escalators are involved, they only apply to the months following their trigger date.<br>NOTE: BILLABLE ACCOUNTS should only be considered a 'deal type' in cases WHERE [BILLABLE ACCOUNTS] = ENABLED AND [MANAGEMENT AGREEMENTS] = DISABLED<br> Manager, I want to show Actual Parking Rate data, So that I can observe where these differ from Budget and Forecast.<br>User Flow<br>Account Manager navigates to the Forecasting module in the system<br>Account Manager selects a site from their assigned locations<br>Account Manager selects the ""Parking Rates"" view<br>System displays the Parking Rates page showing Budget, Forecast, and Actual rates in a tabular format<br>System calculates Actual rates using the formula: Total Actual Revenue ÷ Vehicle Count for each parking stat category<br>System displays Actual rates alongside Budget and Forecast rates for easy comparison<br>Account Manager can toggle between daily, monthly, and yearly views<br>Account Manager can hover over any rate to see the underlying calculation details<br>Account Manager can identify variances between Actual, Budget, and Forecast rates with visual indicators<br>Formula to find the Actual Rate per Parking Stat:<br>(Total Actual [NetExternalRevenue] for Each Revenue Code set) / ([VehicleCount] of each Revenue Code set)<br>What is the query to find budgeted parking rates?<br>First, we find the total actual monthly revenue for the parking stat:<br>SELECT SUM([NETEXTERNALREVENUE]) AS VALET_OVERNIGHT_REVENUE<br>FROM [TP_EDW].[dbo].[vwREVENUE_DAILY_DETAIL_INVOICE]<br>WHERE [SITE] = '0170'<br>  AND [REVENUE_CODE] IN ('VO1', 'VO2', 'VO3')<br>  AND [DATE] BETWEEN '2025-03-01' AND '2025-03-31'<br>-----------------------------------------------------<br>VALET_OVERNIGHT_REVENUE<br>333442.76<br>Then we find the actual vehicle count for the parking stat:<br>SELECT SUM([VEHICLECOUNT]) AS VALET_OVERNIGHT_VEHICLE<br>FROM [TP_EDW].[dbo].[vwREVENUE_DAILY_DETAIL_INVOICE]<br>WHERE [SITE] = '0170'<br>  AND [REVENUE_CODE] IN ('VO1', 'VO2', 'VO3')<br>  AND [DATE] BETWEEN '2025-03-01' AND '2025-03-31'<br>-----------------------------------------------------<br>VALET_OVERNIGHT_VEHICLE<br>6507<br>Actual Rate = VALET_OVERNIGHT_REVENUE / VALET_OVERNIGHT_VEHICLE<br>Budgeted Rate = 333442.76 / 6507<br>Budgeted Rate = $51.24 per day per Valet Overnight parking sale<br>In the above queries, the REVENUE_CODE column contains multiple codes for each stat.  The Parking Stat to REVENUE_CODE value map is below:<br>Parking Stat<br>REVENUE_CODE<br>Valet Daily<br>[REVENUE_CODE] IN ('VD1', 'VD2', 'VD3')<br>Valet Overnight<br>[REVENUE_CODE] IN ('VO1', 'VO2', 'VO3')<br>Valet Monthly<br>[REVENUE_CODE] IN ('VM1', 'VM2', 'VM3')<br>Self Daily<br>[REVENUE_CODE] IN ('SD1', 'SD2', 'SD3')<br>Self Overnight<br>[REVENUE_CODE] IN ('SO1', 'SO2', 'SO3')<br>Self Monthly<br>[REVENUE_CODE] IN ('SM1', 'SM2', 'SM3')<br> | Scenario 1: Basic Navigation to Parking Rates View<br>Given I am logged in as an Account Manager<br>When I click on ""Parking Rates"" view<br>Then the rates should initialize based on Budget data, but visible data and new inputs should be saved as Forecast data, and the table should show Actual rates as they are available for applicable months<br>Scenario 2: Valet Overnight Actual Rate Calculation<br>Given I am viewing the Parking Rates page for site ""0170"" for March 2025<br>When the page loads<br>Then the system should calculate the Valet Overnight Actual Rate as $51.24<br>And this calculation should use the formula: $333,442.76 ÷ 6,507 vehicles<br>And the system should query vwREVENUE_DAILY_DETAIL_INVOICE with REVENUE_CODE IN ('VO1', 'VO2', 'VO3')<br>Scenario 3: Valet Daily Actual Rate Calculation<br>Given I am viewing the Parking Rates page for site ""0170"" for March 2025<br>When the page loads<br>Then the system should calculate the Valet Daily Actual Rate<br>And this calculation should use REVENUE_CODE IN ('VD1', 'VD2', 'VD3')<br>And the formula should be Total Valet Daily Revenue ÷ Total Valet Daily Vehicle Count<br>Scenario 4: Self Parking Actual Rate Calculation<br>Given I am viewing the Parking Rates page for site ""0170"" for March 2025<br>When the page loads<br>Then the system should calculate the Self Daily Actual Rate using REVENUE_CODE IN ('SD1', 'SD2', 'SD3')<br>And the system should calculate the Self Overnight Actual Rate using REVENUE_CODE IN ('SO1', 'SO2', 'SO3')<br>And the system should calculate the Self Monthly Actual Rate using REVENUE_CODE IN ('SM1', 'SM2', 'SM3')<br>Scenario 5: Visual Comparison Between Actual, Budget, and Forecast<br>Given I am viewing the
